answers.answer: There are many causes to the problems that you have described.It could be arthritis, but he really should be examined by vet who could also perform blood-work and other necessary diagnostics.Weight loss and leaking urine could signify diabetes, other endocrine disorders, kidney disease and many more problems.Hip pain and the inability to get up quickly enough due to arthritis to relieve himself appropriately can be treated with medication and nutraceuticals.  Since arthritis is painful giving him some pain medication would make him more comfortable.Urinary incontinence could also be related to age related laxity of the urethral sphincter.  This could also be treated with medication.  Other causes of urinary dribbling are: urinary tract infection, interruption of the spinal nerve innervation to the bladder, and others.  Anti-inflammatories can help with the spinal issue, and antibiotics, cranberry and other medication help with the urinary tract infection.

question: My 13 year old dog is loosing weight, can't move his rear hips very well, and is urinating a little in his sleep. I think its arthritis, and he is just getting old. Is this correct? Or do I need to be more concerned?
title: worried
